Description: Fragment of flattened handle from a Knidian pottery transport amphora. Clay medium, coarse pinkish brown; various dark inclusions. Rectangular stamp with prow symbol and Greek inscription.
Curator's comments: Petrie diary, 1884-1885 (EES Archive XVII 47), p.201, 29. Virginia Grace read NIKH, but the traces do not support this. Pencil(?) '100'. This is either the highest number preserved (after 87) in a series of pencil numbers on stamps from various provenances, or the locus at Naukratis (Well 2), which is specifically stated by Petrie (1886, 18) to be early. Neither is convincing.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (JB.0357)
